page.title: 01Wytham 1986
page.content: In spite of its proximity to Oxford this rural area is very different from the urban developments to the north and west of the city. Wytham village stands in countryside which is well wooded and hilly.Wytham Estate passed to the University in 1942 on condition that its natural beauty was preserved. Building was to be limited. Almost all of the 3000 acre estate lies within the block. The Great Wood spreads from the Seacourt stream to the Thames at Swinford. The river meanders through farmland, feeding Farmoor reservoir in the west. The little of the modern village of Farmoor in the block is in marked contrast with the conservation area of Wytham. Even linked with the Swinford complex of bridge, lock and waterworks, this area is overshadowed by the older, unchanged village.
